alert.note: Alert for Bates; Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 24 at 8:37PM CDT until further notice by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in Missouri... Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Osage River near Schell City. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, flood waters affect the Schell Osage Conservation Area, the Old River Road North of Schell City and Lost Creek west of Schell Lake. Flood waters overflow the main river channel at the gage site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 20.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 445 AM CDT.
